content:
It sounds like you have a solid plan in place for the final rehearsal tonight!

Firstly, it's completely normal to feel a mix of emotions, including anxiety and excitement, as you approach the final rehearsal. It's a natural response to the anticipation and pressure of performing in front of an audience.

Your focus on the school dance fight scene is excellent, especially since you've taken a workshop on stage combat. It's great that you're taking the time to refine your skills and ensure you're performing the choreographed fight moves safely and confidently. Paying attention to your movements and reactions during the rehearsal will help you identify any areas that need improvement and make the necessary adjustments.

It's also excellent that you're open to feedback from the director and other cast members. Being receptive to constructive criticism is a crucial part of the growth and improvement process. Don't be afraid to ask questions or seek clarification on any aspects of the performance that you're unsure about.

Remember to take care of yourself during the rehearsal, both physically and mentally. Make sure to stay hydrated, take breaks when needed, and pace yourself throughout the evening.

One additional suggestion I have is to focus on having fun during the rehearsal. Yes, you want to perfect your performance, but it's also important to enjoy the experience and the fruits of your labor. The more you relax and have fun, the more your confidence and energy will shine through on stage.

How do you plan to take care of yourself during the rehearsal, and what do you do to manage your nerves and anxiety before a performance?
